result.execSummary:
The defendant Krista J Butterbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Krista J Butterbach in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing argument by the State and Atty. Smith.  Statement by defendant's mother.  Statements by future father in law.

The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld Sentence of:

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Compass Assessment and follow through with any recommendations;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment and or schooling;
- No contact with victims or business listed in the criminal complaint .
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Restitution: $0.00

Costs: $ 278.00
DNA Surcharge waived
To be paid as a condition of probation.
WC inmate communication form received today from the Defendant, requesting a bail hearing. NOTE: copy sent to Atty Smith and DA.
Sentencing hearing on April 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Krista J Butterbach in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Smith.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Bound over.  Information filed. Reading is waived.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #4.  Counts #1, 2, 3 and 5 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Smith requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.
from Attorney Smith requesting to waive prelim before Br. 4 on 3/12/15.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
